column4: Hey - ive been looking for a decent text editor (mainly using it for xhtml/css) .. only feature im after is the auto-completion function that dreamweaver has.. any suggestions?
you positive it got that feature? been trying tons of diffrent editors, most of them wants you to write the line before you can 'autocomplete' it, which takes away the whole point
It's very small. Would take about a minute to download yourself.
yea i guess you are right, ill give it a shot :) brb
I can't see any option for autocomplete.
Nor does it appear to be on by default.
it actually had that feature - for html only tho, im almost there :)
What do you mean by autocomplete. Several seem to insert the closing tag (which annoys the crap out of me).
well basicly, if i would start typing something, for example 'ba', dreamweaver would give me a few options starting on 'ba', like background...
I've never looked for it in an editor. Nor have I ever used it.
bah, i feel rather crippled without it, as im used to it.. guess it made me rather lazy :) .. well, thanks for the help mate, so far bluefish was the best actually
If you search Synaptic for "html editor" you get tonnes. I would just install them and try them out.
yea thats basicly what ive been doing so far.. tried a good 10 or so, starts to get pretty boring tho :)
Agreed. I've done it before. I end up just using gedit.
i guess i will end up doing the same in a few hours.. :)
